intro: Oxyanthus cymosus, commonly known as the clustered yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Oxyanthus cymosus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
